abstract: Russell D. Glass of RDG Capital practices his own brand of activist investment, one of quiet insistence that companies should consider selling themselves or breaking apart.
snippet: Russell D. Glass of RDG Capital practices his own brand of activist investment, one of quiet insistence that companies should consider selling themselves or breaking apart.
lead_paragraph: Some 20 investors and analysts recently gathered at the Princeton Club in Manhattan, united by one common thread: their frustration over the stock growth of a financial data processor, DST Systems.

headline.main: An Activist Investor With a Quiet Voice, but a Firm Hand

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
